title: Unit Testing Practice
instructions: Write test functions to verify that the given functions work correctly. Test normal cases, edge cases, and error conditions.
solution:
def is_even(n):
    """Return True if n is even"""
    return n % 2 == 0

def get_first_element(items):
    """Return first element of list"""
    if not items:
        raise ValueError("List is empty")
    return items[0]

def test_is_even():
    """Test is_even function"""
    # Test positive even numbers
    assert is_even(2) == True
    assert is_even(4) == True
    
    # Test positive odd numbers
    assert is_even(1) == False
    assert is_even(3) == False
    
    # Test zero
    assert is_even(0) == True
    
    # Test negative numbers
    assert is_even(-2) == True
    assert is_even(-3) == False

def test_get_first_element():
    """Test get_first_element function"""
    # Test normal case
    assert get_first_element([1, 2, 3]) == 1
    assert get_first_element(["a", "b"]) == "a"
    
    # Test single element
    assert get_first_element([5]) == 5
    
    # Test empty list raises error
    try:
        get_first_element([])
        assert False, "Should have raised ValueError"
    except ValueError as e:
        assert str(e) == "List is empty"
hints: Test multiple scenarios: positive, negative, zero, edge cases
Use assert statements to check conditions
Use try-except to test that exceptions are raised correctly
